paper_metadata.title: MAIN TEXT
paper_metadata.extraction_summary: Extracted genetic variant information related to the TTR gene, including penetrance data.

individual_records.phenotype_details: heart failure with preserved ejection fraction
individual_records.evidence_sentence: Patient P1 was diagnosed at age 62 with heart failure symptoms starting at age 60.
Patient P2 presented with severe left ventricular thickening at age 69.
Patient P3, at age 72, remains asymptomatic despite carrying the variant.
Patient P4 was diagnosed at age 78 with mild heart failure symptoms starting at age 75.

functional_data.summary: The Val122Ile variant is associated with altered TTR stability and amyloid fibril formation.

variants.segregation_data: The variant segregates with disease in families, particularly in male carriers.
variants.population_frequency: Variant is found in 1% of the population in gnomAD.
variants.evidence_level: Moderate evidence based on clinical studies and family segregation.
variants.additional_notes: The variant is one of the most studied in relation to ATTR-CM.
key_quotes: The mutations most commonly associated with cardiac involvement are Val122Ile, Thr60Ala, Leu111Met and Ile68Leu.
Overall structural and functional phenotype was similar between sexes when indexed to body size.

extraction_metadata.notes: All relevant data was extracted from the main text.
